Indicator: The laboratory building is structurally sound and properly maintained
Floors are smooth and easy to clean
Ceilings are intact without cracks or leaks
Sufficient space for all laboratory activities
Separate areas for specimen collection and processing
Adequate storage space for supplies and reagents
Space for equipment maintenance and calibration
Windows are screened to prevent entry of insects
Exhaust fans in areas generating fumes
Proper air circulation throughout the laboratory
Emergency exits clearly marked and accessible
Eye wash station available where chemicals are used
Emergency shower if hazardous chemicals used
Spill kits available for chemical and biological spills
Test menu displayed and available to clients
Turn-around times established for each test
Critical results reporting procedure in place
Daily quality control performed for all tests
Corrective actions taken for QC failures
Inventory system for reagents and supplies
Job descriptions available for all positions
Training plan exists for all staff
Biological safety cabinet certified if required
Sharps containers available and properly used
Biohazard waste segregated and disposed properly
Waste segregated at point of generation
Chemical waste segregated from biological waste
Alternative treatment if autoclave not available
Standard operating procedures available for all tests
